job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Rochester, NH
pros:
Small town hospital with a great culture. Amazing staff and providers throughout. I thoroughly enjoy my job and going to work. 
The benefits are nice as well!
cons: What the future holds for our hospital and current employees.

pros: good working environment, good support and manager
cons: low pay,not enough hours, no equal oppertunities

job_title: RN Case Manager in Rochester, NH
pros: Use to be a family based, employee based, small community hospital and nonprofit. Management cared about their staff and the care that was provided to its patients. That changed.
cons: Upper Management no longer cares about pleasing the staff. Longevity does not matter any longer. Nor does patient satisfaction. FMH has lost multiple doctors, as well as staff recently, and care has suffered due to this. Nursing staff are overworked & underpaid. No longer an enjoyable place to work.

pros: Good staff and stable middle leadership

cons: Corporate U S A Not good

pros: Great co workers that preform great medicine
cons: Large corporate climate out of touch with the work force

pros: Hospital benefits even if you work for an ambulatory center, opportunity to change position within hospital and their ambulatory centers, 8, 10, and 12 hour shift options many places/departments
cons: Management is so poor.  If there are issues in the work place that you're facing you might as well forget about having a strong manager to assist you.  Many of the mangers there are actually the problem.  No standards in the process of hiring managers since likely your manager will not have a degree in management or even a degree at all...Makes for a very unprofessional and unpleasant work environment since overpowering staff rule the roost and drive good staff out.  I worked at 2 of Frisbie's locations with identical outcomes.  I left the organization and realized how messed up it had been there now that I have a strong manager and a healthy work environment.

pros: Benefits package, coworkers and team work
cons: upper management never listening to the workers actually doing the work and compensation

pros: Leadership at  Frisbie Memorial Hospital knows how to ride the high seas of changing times. Very creative in their resolutions and initiatives.  I found the hospital to be a great place to work and where people can really make personal contributions. There is a real team spirit at Frisbie Memorial Hospital.
cons: Continue keeping your ears open to your staff.

pros: Great flexibility with vacation time, good benefits
cons: Very low pay scale and horrible raises. Very under appreciated .

job_title: Director Medical Imaging in Rochester, NH
pros: Great Customer service and Patient Care.  Great Staff.
cons: C-level poor communicators- do not manage employed Providers, short sighted

pros: The associates are very nice.  HR people are very helpful. Workload varies from day to day, keeps from getting repetitive.
cons: Management for pharmacy is very condescending. If you do something wrong, she reprimands you in front of everyone. Very high turn over due to bad management.
